title: Finding the Y-Intercept
text: We must set $$x$$ equal to $$0$$ and solve for f(x) to find the y-intercept. This leavees us with $$\frac{6}{24}$$, or $$\frac{1}{4}$$.
speech: We must set  x  equal to  0  and solve for f(x) to find the y-intercept. This leavees us with  6 over 24, , or  1 fourth .

title: Finding the X-Intercept
text: Now, we must set f(x) equal to $$0$$ and solve $$x$$. There are no x-intercepts.
